verses.roman:
krodhe sandhyā-kāle kājī eka ghare āila
mṛdaṅga bhāṅgiyā loke kahite lāgila

synonyms: krodhe—in anger; sandhyā-kāle—in the evening; kājī—the Chand Kazi; eka ghare—in one home; āila—came; mṛdaṅga—drum; bhāṅgiyā—breaking; loke—unto the people; kahite—to speak; lāgila—began.
translation: Chand Kazi angrily came to one home in the evening, and when he saw kīrtana going on, he broke a mṛdaṅga and spoke as follows.
